availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Massachusetts native. Son of Arrita Pate. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 61.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 5.
"James Monroe Pate," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=85149910&ref=acom) (accessed on April 7, 2017).
Find A Grave, "James Monroe Pate (January 22, 1826-October 10, 1875)," Memorial #85149910, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85149910 (accessed April 7, 2017).
